document.title: Tesfa — AI-Powered Learning for Ethiopian Youth

sections.heading: Project Title
sections.content: Tesfa — AI-Powered Learning for Ethiopian Youth

sections.heading: Pilot Partnership
sections.content: Tesfa + Ethiopian Artificial Intelligence Institute + [TVET/College partner name]

sections.heading: Vision
sections.content: Tesfa’s mission is to empower Ethiopian youth with market-ready technological skills through an AI-assisted learning platform that adapts to each learner and supports instructors with automation and insights. The pilot will demonstrate how AI tools can improve learning outcomes, reduce dropouts, and better align training with real job opportunities in Ethiopia’s growing digital economy.

sections.heading: Goals
bullets: Increase completion rate of digital courses by 40% vs. baseline.
Reduce instructor workload on grading and content creation by 50%.
Detect at-risk learners early and improve retention by 25%.
Generate job-aligned curricula in partnership with employers.
Produce evidence for national AI-in-education strategy development.

rows: Deploy Tesfa MVP (web + mobile-friendly) with 4 skill paths
500 students across Addis and 1 regional TVET
Collect engagement, quiz, and progression data
Analyze results, publish a short impact report

sections.heading: Focused Skill Paths (initial pilot)
bullets: Foundations of Web Development (HTML/CSS/JS + Git basics)
Digital Marketing & AI Tools (content, SEO, analytics)
Mobile Repair & IoT Basics (hardware + connected devices)
Data Literacy for Beginners (Excel → Python intro)

sections.heading: Data & Ethics
bullets: Data stored in compliance with Ethiopian data protection guidelines.
Transparent privacy policy and consent for analytics.
Human oversight on all AI-generated grading and content.

sections.heading: Support Requested from Ethiopian AI Institute
bullets: Institutional endorsement and inclusion in AI-in-Education program.
Access to partner TVETs for pilot execution.
Technical advisory collaboration on AI fairness, data handling, and Amharic NLP integration.
Optional: small co-funding (₦ or USD $xx,xxx) for infrastructure and monitoring.

sections.heading: Deliverables (within 3 months)
bullets: End-of-pilot evaluation report with KPIs and next-phase plan.
